tool.name: addFiles

param.name: projectfile
param.dialogReference: Select the project file. This will be the name of the project provided in the New Project tool, with the .p extension.

param.name: featrastlayer
param.displayname: Feature or Raster Layer to Add
param.dialogReference: Select the file that will be used in the project. This step may be repeated several times. After selecting this file, pick the Type of File in the drop down below.

param.name: typeoffile
param.dialogReference: After selecting the Feature or Raster Layer to Add, pick the type of file in this drop down list. After selecting, it should be added to the table below.

param.name: in_features
param.dialogReference: This dropdown may be ignored. The table lists the feature or raster layer and the type of file it is. These may be deleted using the X button.

param.name: eunits
param.dialogReference: A digital elevation raster layer may have elevation in Feet or Meters above sea level.

param.name: darea
param.dialogReference: Drainage area is used to calculate the Natural Drainage Pathways which are stream pathways derived from the Digital Elevation Model.

param.name: pbuffer
param.dialogReference: A protective buffer is applied to layers creating the Riparian Areas layer. One hundred feet is the default and recommended value.

param.name: ptreecanopy
param.dialogReference: If using Percent Tree Canopy to derive information about trees, select the minimum percentage tree canopy.

param.name: pimp
param.dialogReference: If using Percent Impervious to derive information about trees, select the minimum percentage impervious.

tool.summary: Add Files to the Project, matched to expected files, and modify project settings.
tool.usage: Begin by selecting a project. If a project is not available use the New Project tool. Select the file to be added, using the Feature or Raster Layer to Add folder button. Select the Type of File from the dropdown. Ignore Selected Files. When adding elevation information, select Elevation Units. Other settings can be changed but may by changed.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Add Files to the Project, matched to expected files, and modify project settings.
